required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-label, Non-randomized, Parallel Group Study in Subjects With Mild, Moderate, Severe, or No Renal Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Study to Compare the Pharmacokinetic Profiles of a Single Dose of Ferriprox in Subjects With Impaired Renal Function and Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-center, non-randomized, open-label, single-dose, parallel group study to determine the effect of impaired renal function on the PK of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite following a single oral dose of 33mg/kg Ferriprox®.

detailed_description.textblock: Post-marketing study to evaluate the effect of impaired renal function on the pharmacokinetics (PK) of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite and on the safety of Ferriprox® in subjects with mild, moderate and severe renal impairment as compared to healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Cmax was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal, mild, moderate and severe renal impairment. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Tmax was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose. The results of the Tmax parameter are reported as the median and range (other parameters are reported as mean and standard deviation).

primary_outcome.measure: AUC Zero to Infinity (AUC0-∞) for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-∞ was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: T1/2 for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: T1/2 was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Ae24 for Urine Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Ae24 (the amount excreted in urine from time zero to 24 hours) was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite. Urine samples were collected at the intervals of -2 to 0 hours pre-dose and 0 to 2, 2 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, and 12 to 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Fe24 for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Fe24 (fraction of dose excreted in urine from time zero to 24 hours) was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite. Urine samples were collected at the intervals of -2 to 0 hours pre-dose and 0 to 2, 2 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, and 12 to 24 hours post-dose. Some of the Fe24 values were over 100% which could be explained by variability in urine collection (e.g. incomplete collection of urine into the container) and volume measurement, as well as analytical imprecision.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Ferriprox® in Subjects With Renal Impairment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of dosing until 72 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced adverse events (including any changes of clinical significance in physical examinations, vital signs, 12-lead ECG, and clinical laboratory tests) following a single dose of Ferriprox.

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers, defined as having an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥90 mL/min/1.73m^2. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.
Mild impairment, defined as having an eGFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73m^2. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.
Mild impairment, defined as having an eGFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73m^2. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.
Severe impairment, defined as having an eGFR 15-19 mL/min/1.73m^2. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.

group.title: Normal Hepatic Function (Healthy Volunteers)
group.description: Healthy volunteers as defined by an eGFR ≥90 mL/min/1.73m^2 as determined by the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Study will receive a single 33mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone. Deferiprone

group.title: Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Mild renal impairment defined as eGFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73m^2 as determined by the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Study will receive a single 33mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone. Deferiprone

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment
group.description: Severe renal impairment as defined by an eGFR 15-19 mL/min/1.73m^2 as determined by the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Study will receive a single 33mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone. Deferiprone

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Cmax for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
outcome.description: Cmax was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal, mild, moderate and severe renal impairment. Urine samples were collected at the intervals of -2 to 0 hours pre-dose and 0 to 2, 2 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, and 12 to 24 hours post-dose. Some of the Fe24 values were over 100% which could be explained by variability in urine collection (e.g. incomplete collection of urine into the container) and volume measurement, as well as analytical imprecision.

measure.population: The pharmacokinetic population included all subjects who had sufficient data to derive the value of at least one pharmacokinetic parameter
measure.units: % of dose excreted in urine from 0-24 hr

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 4 days: from the time of administration of study drug until a follow-up telephone call 48 to 72 hours after discharge

group.title: Normal Hepatic Function (Healthy Volunteers)
group.description: Healthy volunteers as defined by an eGFR ≥90 mL/min/1.73m^2 as determined by the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Study will receive a single 33mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone. Deferiprone

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
